intro: Eucalyptus deformis, commonly known as the narrow-leaf mallees, is a species of eucalyptus native to the arid and semi-arid regions of Western Australia. It is characterized by its slender, erect habit and narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in a fine, white pubescence. The plant produces small, globular clusters of white or pale yellow flowers, which appear in spring and attract various pollinators. Eucalyptus deformis is adapted to harsh environmental conditions, including drought and poor soil, making it a resilient component of its native ecosystem. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an important plant in the study of Australian flora.
